title: Antigravity Mastery Quiz
description: Test your understanding of Antigravity for rapid prototyping

questions.question: What is Antigravity's primary advantage over traditional IDEs like Cursor?

options.text: Fastest path from idea to deployed prototype

questions.explanation: Antigravity's unique value proposition is speed-to-prototype. While it's also free (making C partially correct), the primary advantage is the ability to go from idea to deployed app in minutes without any setup or configuration.

questions.question: What does Firebase MCP integration enable in Antigravity?

options.text: Full backend control including auth, database, and hosting

questions.explanation: Firebase MCP gives the AI agent full control over your Firebase backend, including Authentication, Cloud Firestore database, Firebase Hosting, Storage, and Cloud Functions.

questions.question: When should you NOT use Antigravity?

options.text: For working on existing large codebases

questions.explanation: Antigravity excels at creating new projects quickly, but it's not designed for working with existing large codebases. For that, you should use Cursor, Windsurf, or Claude Code which are built for code-level work.

questions.question: What is the recommended multi-tool workflow mentioned in the lesson?

options.text: Validate in Antigravity, develop in Cursor, refactor in Windsurf, architect in Claude Code
Use Cursor for prototypes, Antigravity for production

questions.explanation: The lesson recommends: 1) Validate ideas quickly in Antigravity (1 hour), 2) Rebuild properly in Cursor (1-2 days), 3) Use Windsurf for major refactors, 4) Use Claude Code for complex architecture. This lets you fail fast on bad ideas while investing properly in good ones.

questions.question: What happens when you click 'Deploy' in Antigravity with Firebase MCP?

options.text: You get a downloadable ZIP file
The app is deployed to Firebase Hosting with a public URL
You need to manually configure hosting
It only works with paid Firebase plans

questions.explanation: With Firebase MCP integration, clicking 'Deploy' automatically deploys your application to Firebase Hosting and provides you with a public URL. This is part of the one-click deployment workflow that makes Antigravity so fast for prototyping.

questions.question: What is the primary limitation of Antigravity that requires exporting your project?

options.text: It can only create Python projects
No Git integration, limited testing tools, no local development

questions.explanation: Antigravity lacks Git integration, comprehensive testing tools, and local development capabilities. When you need version control, CI/CD pipelines, test suites, or fine-grained debugging, you should export your project and continue in a traditional IDE like Cursor.
